name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for this compound is oxazole, which has a melting point around 106°C. The methoxybenzylidene group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The phenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The oxazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity, estimated at around +20°C.
